content.text: Express in set notation the shaded regions shown in the Venn diagrams below
find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\),
find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 1\)
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is \(ax^{3} + bx^{2} - 13x + 4\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers. Given that \(2x - 1\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and also a factor of \(\mathrm{p}'(x)\),
Given that \(T = 2\pi l^{\frac{1}{2}}g^{-\frac{1}{2}}\), express \(l\) in terms of \(T, g\) and \(\pi\)
By using the substitution \(y = x^{\frac{1}{3}}\), or otherwise, solve \(x^{\frac{2}{3}} - 4x^{\frac{1}{3}} + 3 = 0\)
Find the gradient of the line
Use your answer to part **(i)** to express \(\mathrm{lg}y\) in terms of \(x\)
Hence express \(y\) in terms of \(x\), giving your answer in the form \(y = A\big(10^{bx^2}\big)\) where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants
When \(\mathrm{lg}y\) is plotted against \(x^{2}\) a straight line is obtained which passes through the points (4, 3) and (12, 7)
Find the coordinates of \(A\)
Find the \(y\)-coordinate of \(B\)
Find \(\int (4\mathrm{e}^{2x} + 16\mathrm{e}^{- 2x})\mathrm{d}x.\)
Hence find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the curve and the line \(AB\). You must show all your working
The diagram shows part of the graph of \(y = 4\mathrm{e}^{2x} + 16\mathrm{e}^{- 2x}\) meeting the \(y\)-axis at the point \(A\) and the line \(x = 1\) at the point \(B\)
State the range of f
Solve \(\operatorname {fg}(x) = 4\)
Functions f and g are such that, for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\),
Find \(\mathrm{h}^{-1}(x)\) and state its range
Find \(\mathrm{h}^{2}(x)\), giving your answer in its simplest form
A function h is such that \(\mathrm{h}(x) = \frac{2x + 1}{x - 4}\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\), \(x \neq 4\)
A curve has equation \(y = \ln \left(\frac{2x + 1}{2x - 1}\right) + 4x\) for \(x > \frac{1}{2}\)
Write \(\ln \left(\frac{2x + 1}{2x - 1}\right)\) as the difference of two logarithms
Using your answer to part (i) show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{a x^{2} + b}{4 x^{2} - 1},\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
Hence find the \(x\)-coordinate of the stationary point on the curve
Determine the nature of this stationary point
Find the number of different ways the 10 people can be chosen if 6 of them are men and 4 of them are women
The group of 8 men and 6 women contains a man and his wife
Find the number of different ways the 10 people can be chosen if both the man and his wife are chosen or neither of them is chosen
10 people are to be chosen, to receive concert tickets, from a group of 8 men and 6 women
Find the number of different 6-digit numbers he could have chosen
Freddie also remembers that his 6-digit code is divisible by 5
Find the number of different 6-digit numbers he could have chosen
Freddie decides to choose a new 6-digit code for his briefcase once he has opened it. He plans to have the 6-digit number divisible by 2 and greater than 600 000, again with no repetitions of digits
Find the number of different 6-digit numbers he can choose
Freddie has forgotten the 6-digit code that he uses to lock his briefcase. He knows that he did not repeat any digit and that he did not start his code with a zero
Show that angle \(P4Q\) is 2.35 radians, correct to 3 significant figures
Find angle \(PBQ\) in radians
Find the perimeter of the shaded region
Find the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows a circle, centre \(A\), radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\), intersecting a circle, centre \(B\), radius \(24\mathrm{cm}\). The two circles intersect at the points \(P\) and \(Q\). The radii \(AP\) and \(AQ\) are tangents to the circle with centre \(B\). The radii \(BP\) and \(BQ\) are tangents to the circle with centre \(A\)
Solve \(3\cos \mathrm{e}2x - 4\sin 2x = 0\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 180^{\circ}.\)
Solve \(3\tan \left(y - \frac{\pi}{4}\right) = \sqrt{3}\) for \(0\leqslant y\leqslant 2\pi\) radians, giving your answers in terms of \(\pi .\)
